intro: Lastrea fijiensis, commonly known as the Fiji starburst, is a flowering plant native to the island of Fiji. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that display vibrant colors. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
